name: Rotha t/a The Wheel
goal:
The Wheel is Ireland’s national association of community, voluntary and charitable organisations. We are unique in our role as a “one-stop shop” for anything related to the charity sector. Through the size and diversity of our membership, we reach the invisible infrastructure of Irish society.

We passionately believe that people, through their participation in community, voluntary and charity organisations, play a central role in improving and enriching life in Ireland. So our simple and ambitious mission is to help make Ireland a more fair and just place for all by strengthening the capacity and capability of these organisations.

Our reputation has grown as a leadership and representative voice for the sector. We are also a bustling hub for practical advice and support. We represent the sector’s shared interests to Government, to other decision-makers and to the media. We promote a better understanding by the public of Irish charities and community organisations and their impacts. We work to ensure that the sector is recognised and respected, adequately resourced and proportionally regulated.

We build networks of interest, share learnings, provide information and deliver essential training on a host of relevant topics. We are enthusiastically committed to transparency, accountability and high standards of practice and governance for our members, the sector and ourselves.

Our Mission is to strengthen the community and voluntary sector’s capacity and capability to play its part in achieving a fair and just society in Ireland by:
• Representing the shared interests of community and voluntary organisations
• Supporting these organisations to do their work
• Promoting the importance of active citizenship
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Audiovisual and Media, Budget, Climate Action, Communication, Culture, Development, Education, Employment and Social Affairs, Environment, Humanitarian Aid, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Youth
euInitiatives:
The Wheel is an experienced, cooperative and willing partner in European projects and in the delivery of contracts on behalf of European institutions. Since 2013, we have operated four projects funded by DG Communications for the promotion of citizen engagement with the European Parliament and in August 2017 we were delighted to win the tender to play a support role to the European Parliament Information Office in Ireland as they roll out the European Ambassador School Programme between now and 2019. This exciting programme aims to raise awareness amongst young people in secondary education of the impact of the European Union in their daily lives. This free programme offers an engaging and interactive format, creative training material for various levels, and provides the opportunity to participate in debate, discussion and events around European Parliament affairs in Ireland.
As the National Contact Point for the Europe for Citizens Programme in Ireland since 2015, The Wheel also promotes understanding and interaction between EU institutions and citizens, deepening their awareness of what it means to be European and supporting the design of transnational projects that develop a sense of European identity. In the 2018 Work Programme for Europe for Citizens, the Future of Europe is a priority and so this is a topic that The Wheel regularly promotes to beneficiaries in Ireland and an area that we are very comfortable in communicating around. Our Twitter account @EU4Citizens has over 1000 followers and regularly encourages discussion on European issues. See here.
In addition to the above, The Wheel operated a capacity building service called Access Europe for civil society on how to access European Union funding. It promoted the value of European working and European active citizenship. Activities included training, information sharing and discussion on topics of a European nature plus the provision of technical advice on European funding applications.
We have recently been given the role of supporting the Irish Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade in the organisation and facilitation of their Citizens’ Dialogue on the Future of Europe for Community and Voluntary Organisations, which is due to take place in Dublin on the 5 April 2018.
Led by the European Programmes Coordinator and supported by the European Programme Officer, The Wheel’s range of European activity is growing annually and rapidly in reach.
